text: You don't have to control your thoughts. You just have to stop letting them control you. - Dan Millman
Nothing diminishes anxiety faster than action.
Take life day by day and be grateful for the little things.
Just because you feel anxious doesn't mean you're in danger.
Breathe. You've survived 100% of your bad days.
Almost everything will work again if you unplug it for a few minutes... including you. - Anne Lamott
Don't believe everything you think.
Sometimes the most productive thing you can do is rest.
Tears come from the heart and not from the brain. - Leonardo da Vinci
It's okay to feel sad. Let yourself rest.
Crying is not a weakness. It's emotional strength.
Dark days don't last forever. You're getting through this.
Sometimes we just need to feel it to heal it.
Be gentle with yourself. You're doing the best you can.
Stars can't shine without darkness.
You are not alone in how you feel.
Speak when you are angry, and you'll make the best speech you'll ever regret. - Ambrose Bierce
Your anger is valid — just don't let it control you.
Channel your energy into something that builds, not breaks.
Take a pause, not a punch.
Don't let someone else's chaos steal your peace.
Anger is a signal, not a solution.
Reacting in anger rarely leads to wisdom.
Breath is your anchor in the storm.
Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions. - Dalai Lama
Let your smile change the world.
Enjoy this moment fully — you deserve it.
Happiness looks good on you.
Let your joy be contagious.
You are allowed to be proud of your happiness.
Capture this feeling and come back to it when needed.
Savor the light when it's bright.
Even ordinary days are part of an extraordinary life.
Neutral moments are the bridges between highs and lows.
Stillness has value too.
Not every day needs to be a big day.
Rest is not inactivity, it's preparation.
Quiet days help you hear yourself better.
Neutral doesn't mean empty — it means balance.
Nothing is wrong. Nothing is right. Just is.
Your surroundings don't define your worth.
Step away from what drains you.
Sometimes you need to declutter both your space and your mind.
Release what doesn't serve you.
It’s okay to feel gross. Breathe and reset.
Change your surroundings, change your state.
Wash away the day and start again.
You are loved more than you know.
Let love in — you are worthy of it.
You radiate warmth.
Love is not a weakness, it's your strength.
You matter deeply to someone.
Your presence is a gift.
Let yourself feel safe in love.
You're a walking example of what's possible.
Your glow is the result of your growth.
Feel proud — you've earned this.
Amazing moments are yours to keep.
You are your own success story.
Celebrate your shine.
You are enough, more than enough.
Unexpected doesn't mean unprepared.
You can handle more than you think.
Even fear means you're trying.
Bravery starts with showing up.
Fear is a sign of growth.
Feel it, then move forward anyway.
This discomfort won't last forever.
You are allowed to pause.
One small step is still progress.
You don't have to do it all at once.
Rest is productive too.
You're not lazy — you're recharging.
Slow down. You're allowed to breathe.
Doing nothing is doing something.
Peace is the result of training your mind to process life as it is.
Inhale peace. Exhale doubt.
Stillness is not the absence of noise, it's the presence of clarity.
Let the quiet become your power.
Serenity begins when expectation ends.
Peace isn't passive. It's chosen.
You are rooted, calm, and strong.
We all mess up. That's how we learn.
What feels huge now will be funny later.
You're allowed to be imperfect.
The bravest people are willing to look silly sometimes.
This too shall pass — and probably make a great story.
Everyone has their cringe moments. It's part of growing.
Mistakes are proof you're trying.
Walk in like you own the place — or at least belong there.
Confidence comes from action, not perfection.
Your shine doesn't dim anyone else's light.
You've worked for this feeling. Wear it proudly.
You don't need permission to be great.
Be your own hype person.
Confidence is quiet — insecurities are loud.
